RAPOLAS_intro.text: You step into a warm, cosy room with soft lights. A small, bright green frog is perched on a large black speaker, scribbling intently in a tiny notebook. He looks up as you enter, smiles, and gives a friendly wave.

RAPOLAS_intro_b.text: ‘Ah, hello! You're here for the course, wonderful! I'm Rapolas. I'm a team dynamics facilitator. And this,' he pats the speaker, 'is my temporary office!’

choices.text: ‘An office? Why the speaker?’
‘Are you the DJ?’
‘You look busy. What are you working on?’
‘If you don't mind my asking, what kind of frog are you?’

RAPOLAS_silly_dj.text: ‘Oh, ha! Goodness, no. I'm just borrowing it. I'm a team facilitator, not a musician! Though, my next clients *are* a music group, coincidentally enough.’

choices.text: ‘A music group? Tell me about them.’
‘Let's go back. Why are you on the speaker?’
‘What kind of frog are you?’

RAPOLAS_speaker_answer.text: ‘It’s a great vantage point! It reminds me of a tree, and I do my best thinking when I'm climbing. It's just an instinct, you know? I'm just finalizing my plan for a big client retreat. I leave for it first thing Friday morning.’

choices.text: ‘What's the client retreat about?’
‘You mentioned climbing. What kind of frog are you?’

RAPOLAS_group_intro.text: ‘I'm prepping for a new client. A brand-new music group. I'm just working on their teambuilding plan now. I leave for their retreat on Friday.’

RAPOLAS_group_intro_b.text: ‘Honestly, I'm a bit nervous. I haven't met them in person, just got the client briefing. It's a team of six. The leader (my client) plays violin. Then there's a drummer who... well, growls. A vocalist who's a crow. A wind-pipe player. A quiet, broody bassist. And a dancer. They sound... intense.’

choices.text: ‘That's quite a lineup. What's the hardest part to plan for?’
‘Maybe you can teach me some of your techniques?’
‘What kind of frog are you? You seem... specialized.’

RAPOLAS_species_intro.text: ‘I'm a European Tree Frog! *Hyla arborea*, to be precise. We're known for this bright green 'leaf' skin and our climbing ability. We have these wonderful adhesive discs on our toes.’

choices.text: ‘Wow! Can you stick to the wall?’
‘So you must be a good swimmer too, right?’

RAPOLAS_silly_stick.text: ‘Ha! Not a perfectly flat, painted wall, no. Our adhesive pads aren't *that* good. But this speaker? Or a nice, damp leaf or tree branch? Absolutely. It's a grip, not suction!’

choices.text: ‘So you must be a good swimmer too, right?’
‘You mentioned a team...’

RAPOLAS_species_intro_b.text: ‘Ah, that's the tricky part! We *can* swim, but we're not strong swimmers. We're built for climbing. We're meant for calm, stagnant water, like ponds or ditches.’

RAPOLAS_species_intro_c.text: ‘In a fast-moving *river*? (He shudders). We just don't have the endurance. We'd tire out and... well. It's a serious risk. And this retreat on Friday? The client insists on holding it right by a river. So, I'm... (he taps his notebook) ...managing my anxiety.’

choices.text: ‘You mentioned a team retreat? What’s the challenge there?’
‘You look busy. What are you working on?’
‘Let's talk about something else.’

RAPOLAS_challenge_hub_entry.text:
Rapolas opens his tiny notebook with slightly shaky hands. You see six quick, nervous sketches:

• A dark violin with intense, scratchy lines.
• A big wolf-man growling, with a tiny tear in its eye.
• A small crow flapping its wings, papers flying everywhere.
• A little wind swirl with a worried face, blowing leaves.
• A man in a dark coat, arms crossed, no smile.
• A woman with long hair, spinning in circles with a big smile.

choices.text: ‘Tell me about the growler.’
‘Tell me about the flapping crow.’
‘Tell me about the wind-maker.’
‘What kind of music do they even play?’
‘Let’s learn the theory. What is Emotional Intelligence?’
‘Good luck!’ (Leave)

RAPOLAS_silly_music.text: ‘You know, I haven't the slightest! The client was very focused on their *dynamics*, not their... uh... discography. He did mention his violin is key? I'm just there to help them stop... well, growling at each other.’

RAPOLAS_challenge_growler_A.text: ‘The leader says he growls when he's scared, not angry. Apparently he broke a chair already. My goal is to make him feel safe when we meet.’

choices.text: ‘What would help him?’

RAPOLAS_challenge_growler_B.text: ‘That's the question! As a facilitator, what would *you* do?’

choices.text: ‘Give him space. Let him approach you.’
‘Show you are calm. Be a good example.’
‘Give him a simple, physical job to do.’

RAPOLAS_advice_growler_space.text: ‘Yes! Good. Don't crowd him. That's about 'Social Awareness.' I'll wait for him. Thank you!’

RAPOLAS_advice_growler_rules.text: ‘Good! 'Self-Management' on my part. He'll see I'm not a threat. I will stay calm and strong.’

RAPOLAS_advice_growler_task.text: ‘Smart! 'Relationship Management.' Give him a task, not a conversation. I'll ask him to help set up the equipment. He's probably strong.’

RAPOLAS_challenge_crow_A.text: ‘Ah, the vocalist. The client says she flaps and caws when she's nervous, and she's *always* nervous. And... (he checks his notes) ...'has an aversion to silver'? Odd. I need to figure out how to ground her.’

choices.text: ‘What would *you* do?’
‘Ask her what she needs to feel comfortable.’
‘Maybe don't wear any silver?’

RAPOLAS_advice_crow_ask.text: ‘Direct and empathetic. I like it. A good 'Social Awareness' check-in. Thank you!’

RAPOLAS_advice_crow_silver.text: ‘Ha! You're right. So simple. I'll leave my silver pen at home. That's good 'Relationship Management'—adapting to their needs. Smart!’

RAPOLAS_challenge_wind_A.text: ‘He apparently makes little winds... *inside*... when he's upset. Papers fly! The leader says he's arrogant but also very fragile. A tough combo.’

choices.text: ‘What would *you* do?’
‘Acknowledge his feelings: 'I see you're upset.'’
‘Give him a small job: 'Can you use that wind to... hold the door?'’

RAPOLAS_advice_wind_name.text: ‘Yes! Name the feeling. Show him I'm paying attention. That's 'Social Awareness.' I'll try that on Friday.’

RAPOLAS_advice_wind_redirect.text: ‘Ha! Redirect the behavior! 'Relationship Management.' Turn a disruption into a contribution. That's brilliant! I'll use that.’

RAPOLAS_ei_hub_entry.text: Rapolas puts down his pen. ‘Yes, of course! The core theory. Emotional Intelligence, according to Goleman, has four main parts. Which one should we review?’

choices.text: ‘What is Self-Awareness?’
‘What is Self-Management?’
‘What is Social Awareness?’
‘What is Relationship Management?’
‘This all sounds great... but is it *really* going to work on them?’
‘Let's talk about the team challenges again.’
‘I think you're ready!’ (Leave)

RAPOLAS_silly_doubt.text: ‘(He chuckles) A fair question. But it's the only way. You can't build a house... or a band... on a shaky foundation. These four dimensions *are* the foundation. Without them, the team... (he taps his notebook) ...the team will just collapse into chaos. It's vital!’

RAPOLAS_ei_self_awareness_A.text: ‘It’s knowing your *own* emotions. I feel it in my body. My legs get shaky when I'm nervous—like I am about that river! Just *noticing* that feeling, and naming it 'anxiety,'—that is Self-Awareness.’

RAPOLAS_ei_self_management_A.text: ‘It’s what you *do* with that feeling. My legs are shaky (Self-Awareness), but I can't run away. I must breathe slow, count to five, and *choose* to act calmly. That is Self-Management.’

RAPOLAS_ei_social_awareness_A.text: ‘That’s turning your awareness outwards. Empathy. I *watch* the team. The growler’s ears might go down. That means he's scared, not angry. Seeing that *difference* is Social Awareness.’

RAPOLAS_ei_relationship_management_A.text: ‘That's using all that data to guide the team. I see the 'wind-maker' is arrogant and the 'bassist' is withdrawn. I must *actively* build a bridge between them. That is Relationship Management.’

RAPOLAS_re_entry.text: Rapolas is still on the big speaker, reviewing his notes. He smiles when he sees you.

RAPOLAS_re_entry_hub.text: ‘Hello again! Back to help me prep for my problem clients? I still have to finish my plan before Friday. What else can I help you with?’

choices.text: ‘Let's talk about the team challenges again.’
‘Let's review the EI theory.’
‘I just wanted to say hi.’
‘I think you're ready!’ (Leave)

RAPOLAS_end.text: ‘Thank you for all the help! I feel much better. See you after Friday – if the 'wind guy' doesn’t blow me and all my notes straight into that river!’ *He giggles nervously and hugs his notebook tight.*
